entry.title: OpenSea Delisted This Game's NFTs—Then the Creators Got Their Revenge
entry.summary: The makers of OpenSeason gave the major marketplace a reference in the Fortnite-like NFT game—and it's impossible to miss. Here’s why.

entry.title: This Week in Crypto Games: Pixels Token Launch, N64 on Bitcoin, Portal Breaks Record
entry.summary: Catch up on this week’s biggest crypto and NFT gaming news and find some weekend reads in our latest roundup.

entry.title: You Can Play Super Nintendo, N64, and Other Classic Games on Bitcoin—Here’s How
entry.summary: UPDATED: Thanks to Ordinals, you can find working video games and emulated consoles inscribed on the Bitcoin blockchain. Here’s how to play them.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Miguel Faus: How Web3 Filmmaking is 'Taking the Castle'
entry.summary: Miguel Faus, director of NFT-funded feature film "Calladita," joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the film's recent premiere and how the "radically independent" decentralized Film3 movement is evolving.

entry.title: Satoshi Lore Grows as More Bitcoin Inventor Emails Emerge
entry.summary: Nakamoto wrote that calling Bitcoin an investment was “dangerous” and said touting its anonymity was “shady.”

entry.title: Pudgy Penguins Teams Up With Unstoppable Domains
entry.summary: Pudgy Penguins CEO Luca Netz and Unstoppable Domains COO Sandy Carter joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the launch of the NFT collection's .pudgy domains, its second line of toys at Walmat, and the upcoming launch of the Pudgy World game.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum Steals the Show, Bitcoin Loses Steam, and AI Tokens Explode
entry.summary: Ethereum and Uniswap stole the show this week. AI tokens also exploded.

entry.title: Binance Must Pay $4.3 Billion In Federal Case as CZ Awaits Sentencing
entry.summary: Federal prosecutors called the criminal fine and financial penalty "the largest enforcement action" in the agency's history.

entry.title: Bitcoin Halving and BTC Price: Will This Time Be Different?
entry.summary: Bitcoin is in a different place than it was four years ago, the last time the cryptocurrency underwent a halving. Here’s what you need to know.

entry.title: You Can Now Move Brave Browser Rewards On-Chain With a Solana Wallet
entry.summary: The popular web browser now allows BAT transfers to self-custody Solana wallets—and the team hasn't ruled out other blockchain integrations.

entry.title: AI Tokens Resist Cooling Crypto Market as Bitcoin, Ethereum Wobble
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum may be near a small correction just days after posting big gains in intra-day and intra-week sessions.

entry.title: Designer Stephy Fung: 'Taking a Stand' For Digital Fashion With New SYKY Collection
entry.summary: The 'Four Dragons' collection from digital fashion collective SYKY celebrates the Chinese Year of the Dragon.

entry.title: 'No Guarantee' Bitcoin Halving Will Be Favorable for Miners: Riot Platforms
entry.summary: Experts warn that miners should get "ready to shut down unprofitable machines" after the Bitcoin halving cuts rewards.

entry.title: Portal Fever: Record $8.6 Billion Staked for Binance Rewards Ahead of Game Token Airdrop
entry.summary: Binance reports record-breaking demand for the Portal staking pools ahead of the cross-chain gaming token's listing next week.

entry.title: Improbable Chief Product Officer: Web3 Games Need to Put Experience, Game Logic Onchain
entry.summary: Improbable's Rob Whitehead joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the metaverse technology firm's collaborations with blue-chip NFT collections, and how adding tens of thousands of players to a game will work in practice.

entry.title: Uniswap Price Skyrockets After Foundation Proposes Long-Awaited Staking Rewards
entry.summary: Decentralized exchange Uniswap may soon have an upgrade to reward holders of governance tokens. The price of UNI has surged as a result.

entry.title: Xai Gaming Token Hits All-Time High, Ronin Still Recovering After Founder’s Wallets Drained
entry.summary: Ronin (RON) is gradually rebounding after Axie Infinity co-founder Jeff Zirlin’s wallets were hacked, while XAI jumped to a new peak.

entry.title: AVAX Dips as Avalanche Network Faces Block Production Halt
entry.summary: The suspected “esoteric bug” has not helped AVAX performance, which is down for the fifth day in a row this week.

entry.title: Trump Softens His Bitcoin Stance: 'A Lot of People Are Doing It'
entry.summary: I can "live with it one way or the other," he told Fox News during an interview this week.

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin Wary of Pushing Too Much Complexity to Ethereum L2s
entry.summary: An L1 consensus failure might create a day of panic for devs, but "with an L2 bug, people could permanently lose lots of money." he said.

entry.title: $3 Billion in Bitcoin Options Expire Today—Here’s Why It Matters
entry.summary: Today’s $3 billion expiry is nothing compared to the open interest accumulating for March expiry—right before the Bitcoin halving.

entry.title: Can Robot Lawn Mowers Run ‘Doom’? Yes Indeed
entry.summary: "Rip, shear, mow, and tear." Husqvarna and id Software are teaming up to release a version of Doom that plays on Wi-Fi lawn mowers in April.

entry.title: ‘Axie Infinity’ Founder’s Ronin Wallets Hacked for $9.5 Million in Ethereum
entry.summary: Jeff “Jiho” Zirlin tweeted that his personal wallets on the Ronin chain were compromised as funds were taken and sent to Tornado Cash.

entry.title: FTX Can Now Sell Its $1B Stake in Anthropic to Repay Creditors
entry.summary: The value of the AI company's shares held by FTX has doubled since the last time a sale was contemplated.

entry.title: Kraken Decries ‘Expansive New Theory’ Behind SEC Lawsuit, Calls for Dismissal
entry.summary: The crypto exchange says Gary Gensler's agency is trying to “commandeer expansive new authority over the U.S. economy.”

entry.title: Block Says Its Bitcoin Bets, Boosted By the Cash App, Yielded $207M In Gains
entry.summary: The Jack Dorsey-led payment provider notched a 90% year-over-year increase in Bitcoin gross profit, driving its stock up in after-hours trading.

entry.title: Worldcoin, Nvidia Hit Record Highs as AI Hype Fuels Crypto and Stock Market Rally
entry.summary: The company that wants to scan your eyeballs for some cash is flying high, along with other projects connected with artificial intelligence.

entry.title: PancakeSwap Launching 'Nemesis Downfall' Shooter With Crypto Rewards
entry.summary: First-person shooter Nemesis Downfall is PancakeSwap's third game, offering ND token rewards on BNB Chain in its upcoming open beta.

entry.title: Reddit Signs Deal with Google for AI Model Training
entry.summary: The social news platform deepens its relationship with the search giant, trading access to its vast trove of user-generated content for greater visibility.

entry.title: Coinbase, a16z Take SEC to Court Over 'Unlawful' Crypto Overreach
entry.summary: A coalition of crypto giants including Coinbase and Andreessen Horowitz filed suit against the SEC in Texas, seeking regulatory clarity.

entry.title: No, Google Is Not Shutting Down Gmail
entry.summary: A Twitter hoax is sparking some panic and some schadenfreude over Google's mixed record on services.

entry.title: Starknet Price Jumps After Ethereum Scaler Bows to Pressure Over Token Unlock Schedule
entry.summary: StarkWare announced Thursday that it will gradually allocate Starknet tokens to contributors and investors following backlash.

entry.title: ‘We're Promising Nothing’: Telegram Game Notcoin Has 25 Million Players and a Soon-to-be-Real Token
entry.summary: Notcoin players have mined trillions of virtual coins by tapping in Telegram. Co-creator Sasha Plotvinov explains what comes next.

entry.title: What Is Notcoin? Co-Creator Sasha Plotvinov Explains the Viral Telegram Game and Token
entry.summary: Notcoin, a simple clicker-style game within messaging app Telegram, has racked up over 25 million players since the start of 2024 and plans to convert the trillions of virtual coins mined so far into a real crypto token on The Open Network. Open Builders founder Sasha Plotvinov joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to explain the viral phenomenon.

entry.title: Reddit Files to Go Public, Says It Invested in Bitcoin and Ethereum
entry.summary: Social media site Reddit wants to go public, an SEC filing shows. It also reveals that the company has Bitcoin and Ethereum.

entry.title: Stable Diffusion 3 Is Here—And the AI Image Generator Blows Away MidJourney, Dall-E 3 and Google ImageFX
entry.summary: The latest open-source model from Stability AI excels at prompt adherence and can understand natural language instead of keywords and tags.

entry.title: Bitcoin Inventor Satoshi Nakamoto Emails Revealed in Court
entry.summary: Fresh Satoshi Nakamoto lore emerges as cypherpunk Adam Back shares 2008-2009 emails with the Bitcoin inventor.

entry.title: Coinbase Says It's Still Accessible in Nigeria Despite Reported Crypto Ban
entry.summary: Nigerian authorities are reportedly blocking citizens' access to popular crypto trading platforms.

entry.title: Coinbase Backs Grayscale's Ethereum ETF: 'Virtually Identical' to Bitcoin ETFs
entry.summary: Citing Ethereum's technical configuration and market capitalization, Coinbase believes the SEC should approve an ETH spot ETF.

entry.title: 'Pirate Nation' Studio Reveals Network for Fully On-Chain Games on Arbitrum
entry.summary: Proof of Play’s Multichain network will power fully on-chain games, starting with Pirate Nation, but will open up to other developers.

entry.title: 'Pixels' Founder Luke Barwikowski on the Game's Wild Rise and Ronin Move
entry.summary: Ahead of the PIXEL token launch, Pixels game founder Luke Barwikowski joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the hectic last few months—and why the game migrated between Ethereum scaling networks, from Polygon to Ronin.

entry.title: How Arbitrum Won the 'ApeChain' Vote for an ApeCoin Ethereum Scaler
entry.summary: Offchain Labs co-founder and CEO Steven Goldfeder joined Rug Radio's "FOMO Hour" to discuss the ApeCoin DAO's vote to create an Ethereum layer-2 gaming network on Arbitrum for the Bored Ape Yacht Club ecosystem.

entry.title: Recommend-To-Earn: Tokenizing Travel Recommendations with Sam Simmons
entry.summary:
Reza is joined by Sam Simmons, founder of MintPass.
They discuss: - The Parallels between Professional Poker and Crypto - The profitability of Ethics - The "Recommend-To-Earn" economy

entry.title: The Collected: Grant Riven Yun's Journey Through Art and Medicine
entry.summary: The Collected's Rachel Wilkins joins digital artist Grant Riven Yun to explore his remarkable journey blending art with medical studies, to achieve over $2 million in sales.

entry.title: Nifty Island Co-Founder on Why Play-to-Airdrop Is the Game's 'Booster Rocket'
entry.summary: Nifty Island co-founder Charles Smith joins Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward to discuss the game's play-to-airdrop campaign, why token incentives are so important to getting crypto games off the ground, and how the team plans to sustain its growth going forward.

entry.title: Pixels: The Hot Crypto Game and Airdrop Explained in One Minute or Less
entry.summary: Rug Radio Creator and crypto influencer AshleyDCan explains the popular Ronin farming game Pixels and details around the upcoming PIXEL token airdrop.

entry.title: Ethereum Scaler Blast Explained in One Minute or Less
entry.summary: Rug Radio Creator and crypto influencer AshleyDCan explains Ethereum layer-2 scaling network Blast, from the creators of top NFT marketplace Blur, including its upcoming airdrop and how to participate.

entry.title: Pixels Founder: Why PIXEL Token Launch Feels Like 'Day One' for Ronin Game
entry.summary: Luke Barwikowski, founder of farming game Pixels on Ronin, joins Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward to discuss the incoming launch of the PIXEL token and why he sees it as such a turning point for the rising blockchain game.

entry.title: Animoca’s Yat Siu: How Crypto Gaming Gains Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Yat Siu, CEO and co-founder of Animoca Brands, joins the FOMO Hour to discuss his view of the Web3 gaming space, how 2024 is already shaping up to be a big year for crypto gaming, the importance of education in the Web3 space, and much, much more.

entry.title: Shrapnel STX1 Early Access Gameplay
entry.summary: Gameplay footage from the STX1 early access gameplay demo of Shrapnel, a first-person shooter built on Avalanche.

entry.title: Farcaster: Has Decentralized Social Media Finally Arrived?
entry.summary: Rug Radio creator Benjamin White digs into the rise of Farcaster, the decentralized social media platform that's challenging Twitter following the launch of its Frames feature. Is this the decentralized social media app that finally clicks with the masses?

entry.title: Why Gmoney Took Out a $1 Million Loan on a CryptoPunks NFT
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector and entrepreneur Gmoney joined Rug Radio's live "FOMO Hour" show to discuss why he took out a $1 million loan on one of the most recognizable CryptoPunks NFTs around.

entry.title: Solana Hunger Games: Explained in One Minute or Less
entry.summary: Rug Radio Creator and crypto influencer AshleyDCan explains the latest sensation taking over timelines on Crypto Twitter, Solana Hunger Games. The new "crypto AR" game from GG.zip is backed by Delphi and plans to launch in the spring. Here's what going on, explained in one minute or less.

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: Gala Marija Vrbanic
entry.summary:
Tribute Brand founder and CEO Gala Marija Vrbanic joins 5 Questions With SCENE to discuss not just fashion, but graffiti crimes, fishless aquariums, and the apparently emergent sport of wind chasing.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: Why Is Everyone Talking About Jupiter on Solana?
entry.summary: Rug Radio Creator and crypto influencer AshleyDCan explains why the crypto world can't stop talking about Solana's Jupiter. What is JUP? Who qualified for the airdrop? And will there be another round?

entry.title: Jupiter Founder Meow Unloads on the Solana Airdrop 'FUD'
entry.summary: Meow, the pseudonymous founder of Solana DEX aggregator Jupiter, made a surprise appearance today on Rug Radio's "FOMO Hour" to address the JUP airdrop "FUD," and explain why he believes the backlash to the team's launch liquidity pool is unfounded.
